name: Penciljam Bengaluru at Chitrakala Parishath
description:
We are drawing at Karnataka Chitrakala Parishath.

Karnataka Chitrakala Parishath is a landmark institution in Bengaluru’s cultural landscape, founded in 1960 by art visionaries including Prof. M. S. Nanjunda Rao to promote and preserve the visual arts. Over more than six decades it has grown into a vibrant art complex with dozens of galleries showcasing traditional Mysore paintings, folk art, modern and contemporary works, as well as collections by celebrated artists like Nicholas and Svetoslav Roerich.
How to join this session
You don't need artistic skill to participate in this event - just boundless curiosity and a love for drawing. To connect with other participants, please use our community on Discord.

If this is your first time and would like future update on events, and more. Please register here.

Once you arrive at the location, choose a spot you'd like to sketch and get comfortable.
 Things to carry for this session

 	A sketchbook/paper/drawing surface
 	Pencils or any medium you would like to try out
 	Wet media/paint are not allowed inside the gallery spaces
 	A portable chair/mat. If the location has no seating, we tend to sit on the ground
 	Water bottle and snacks

How to get there
Follow the location map provided

name: Penciljam Bengaluru at National Gallery of Modern Arts (NGMA)
description:
Manikyavelu Mansion, once home to businessman-turned-aristocrat Vilum Manickavelu Mudaliar, was acquired by the government at an auction. Restored and repurposed, it became the southern centre of the National Gallery of Modern Art (NGMA) in 2009.
How to join this session
You don't need artistic skill to participate in this event - just boundless curiosity and a love for drawing. To connect with other participants, please use our community on Discord.

If this is your first time and would like future update on events, and more. Please register here.

Once you arrive at the location, choose a spot you'd like to sketch and get comfortable.
Rules at this location

 	Large easels/portable chairs are not allowed within the Gallery.
 	Wet media are not allowed inside the gallery/exhibit spaces
 	Be mindful to not block the walking paths

 	Pencils or any medium you would like to try out
